mso-no-proof:yes'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;color:black;mso-bidi-font-style:italic;
mso-no-proof:yes'>INSTRUCTIONS:<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;color:black;mso-bidi-font-style:italic;
mso-no-proof:yes'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>(i) Federal
policy (OMB Circular A-130) specifies Government customer compliance with the
Federal Information Security Modernization Act of 2014 (FISMA 2014) as
implemented by Federal Information Processing Standards Publication 200 (FIPS
200), <i>Minimum Security Requirements for Federal Information and Information
Systems</i>. This standard specifies minimum security requirements Federal
agencies and federal contractors must meet, defined <span class=GramE>through
the use of</span> security controls described in National Institute of
Standards and Technology (NIST) Special Publication (SP) 800-53 Rev. 5, “<i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Security and Privacy Controls for
Information Systems and Organizations</i>.”<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>(ii) Complete
the enclosed Information Assurance Checklist.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>The purpose of Control Implementation Statements is to provide an
overview of the intended application of each selected control in the context of
a specific system with a sufficient level of detail to correctly implement the
control and to subsequently assess the effectiveness of the control as
implemented in the system.</span><span class=cf01><span style='font-size:9.0pt'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></span></span><span style='font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>For
Organizational Defined Parameters (ODP)</span><span class=cf01><span
style='font-size:9.0pt'> </span></span><span style='font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>in
<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>[brackets]</i> found within some of the
descriptions, please replace the <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>[brackets]</i>
with information about how you currently execute or propose to implement those
items.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>(iii) The
Government will evaluate the Information Assurance Checklist submitted as part
of Offeror’s proposal to determine whether the Offeror understands the minimum
security controls, and has processes, personnel, and infrastructure that
currently complies or demonstrates a reasonable approach to becoming compliant
with all the minimum security controls for at least a low-impact information
system.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Text for the low-impact
information system controls are included in the table.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>Additional
security controls may be determined at the task-order level.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The tables below note controls which may be
applicable for Moderate or High Impact systems. <span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span><span
style='color:#222222;background:white'>The tables below also include a mapping
to the United States Space Force (USSF) Commercial Satellite Communications
Office (CSCO) Infrastructure Asset Pre-Assessment (IA-Pre) Security Controls
List. The USSF CSCO is the program office that oversees the procurement of all
COMSATCOM for the DoD and is by far our largest customer. The IA-Pre assessments&nbsp;will
be conducted by the USSF for assets&nbsp;owned by COMSATCOM vendors separately
from our IA Checklist review process, but we wanted to inform vendors of that
process and&nbsp;provide a mapping to the IA-Pre controls list for your reference</span>.
<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>Note:<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Control Enhancements that are included in
IA-PRE but are not part of the minimum security controls are noted in the
IA-PRE column corresponding to the parent control.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>a. Define and document the types of
  accounts allowed and specifically prohibited for use within the system;<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>b. Assign account managers;<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>c. Require [Assignment:
  organization-defined prerequisites and criteria] for group and role membership;<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>d. Specify:<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>1. Authorized users of the system;<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>2. Group and role membership; and<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>3. Access authorizations (i.e.,
  privileges) and [Assignment: organization-defined attributes (as required)]
  for each account;<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>e. Require approvals by
  [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] for requests to create
  accounts;<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>f. Create, enable, modify, disable,
  and remove accounts in accordance with [Assignment: organization-defined
  policy, procedures, prerequisites, and criteria];<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>g. Monitor the use of accounts;<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>h. Notify account managers and
  [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] within:<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>1. [Assignment:
  organization-defined time period] when accounts are no longer <span
  class=GramE>required;</span><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>2. [Assignment:
  organization-defined <span class=GramE>time period</span>] when users are
  terminated or transferred; and<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>3. [Assignment:
  organization-defined time period] when system usage or need-to-know changes
  for an <span class=GramE>individual;</span><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>i. Authorize access to the system
  based on:<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>1. A valid access authorization;<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>2. Intended system usage; and<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>3. [Assignment:

  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>j. Review accounts for compliance

  frequency];<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
  <p class=Default><span style='mso-bookmark:OLE_LINK2'><span style='mso-bookmark:
  OLE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>k. Establish and implement a

  </td>
  <td width="33%" valign=top style='width:33.12%;border-top:none;border-left:

  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>a. Display [Assignment: organization-defined system use
  notification message or banner] to users before granting access to the system
  that provides privacy and security notices consistent with applicable laws,
  executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and
  guidelines and state that:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>1. Users are accessing a U.S. Government system;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>2. System usage may be monitored, recorded, and subject to
  audit;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>3. Unauthorized use of the system is prohibited and subject to
  criminal and civil penalties; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>4. Use of the system indicates consent to monitoring and
  recording;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>b. Retain the notification message or banner on the screen until
  users acknowledge the usage conditions and take explicit actions to log on to
  or further access the system; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>c. For publicly accessible systems:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>1. Display system use information [Assignment:
  organization-defined conditions], before granting further access to the
  publicly accessible system;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>2. Display references, if any, to monitoring, recording, or
  auditing that are consistent with privacy accommodations for such systems
  that generally prohibit those activities; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>3. Include a description of the authorized uses of the system<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>

  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:2.8pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>a.
  Develop, document, and disseminate to [Assignment: organization-defined
  personnel or roles]:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:2.8pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>1.
  [Selection (one or more): Organization-level; Mission/business process-level;
  System level] contingency planning policy that:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:2.8pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>(a)
  Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment,
  coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:2.8pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>(b)
  Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives,
  regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:2.8pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>2.
  Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the contingency planning
  policy and the associated contingency planning controls;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:2.8pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>b.
  Designate an [Assignment: organization-defined official] to manage the
  development, documentation, and dissemination of the contingency planning
  policy and procedures; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:2.8pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>c.
  Review and update the current contingency planning:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:2.8pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>1.
  Policy [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following
  [Assignment: organization-defined events]; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>

  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;

  none;text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  mso-bidi-font-family:Vrinda'>CP-2 <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width="17%" valign=top style='width:17.32%;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid black 1.0pt;border-right:solid black 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid black .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid black .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid black .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:
  6.0pt;margin-left:0in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;mso-bidi-font-family:
  Vrinda'>CONTINGENCY PLAN<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width="33%" valign=top style='width:33.12%;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid black 1.0pt;border-right:solid black 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid black .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid black .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid black .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>a. Develop a contingency plan for the system that:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>1. Identifies essential mission and business functions and
  associated contingency <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>requirements;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>2. Provides recovery objectives, restoration priorities, and
  metrics;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>3. Addresses contingency roles, responsibilities, assigned
  individuals with contact information;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>4. Addresses maintaining essential mission and business
  functions despite a system disruption, compromise, or failure; <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>5. Addresses eventual, full system restoration without
  deterioration of the controls originally planned and implemented;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>6. Addresses the sharing of contingency information; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>7. Is reviewed and approved by [Assignment: organization-defined
  personnel or roles];<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>b. Distribute copies of the contingency plan to [Assignment:
  organization-defined key contingency personnel (identified by name and/or by
  role) and organizational elements];<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>c. Coordinate contingency planning activities with incident
  handling activities;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>d. Review the contingency plan for the system [Assignment:
  organization-defined frequency];<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>e. Update the contingency plan to address changes to the
  organization, system, or environment of operation and problems encountered
  during contingency plan implementation, execution, or testing;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>f. Communicate contingency plan changes to [Assignment:
  organization-defined key contingency personnel (identified by name and/or by
  role) and organizational elements];<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>g. Incorporate lessons learned from contingency plan testing,
  training, or actual contingency activities into contingency testing and
  training; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>h. Protect the contingency plan from unauthorized disclosure and
  modification.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width="19%" valign=top style='width:19.46%;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid black 1.0pt;border-right:solid black 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid black .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid black .5pt;

  Vrinda'>AUTHENTICATOR MANAGEMENT <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width="33%" valign=top style='width:33.12%;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid black 1.0pt;border-right:solid black 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid black .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid black .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid black .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>Manage system authenticators by:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>a. Verifying, as part of the initial authenticator distribution,
  the identity of the individual, <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>group, role, service, or device receiving the authenticator;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>b. Establishing initial authenticator content for any
  authenticators issued by the organization;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>c. Ensuring that authenticators have sufficient strength of
  mechanism for their intended use;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>d. Establishing and implementing administrative procedures for
  initial authenticator distribution, for lost or compromised or damaged
  authenticators, and for revoking authenticators;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>e. Changing default authenticators prior to first use;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>f. Changing or refreshing authenticators [Assignment:
  organization-defined time period by authenticator type] or when [Assignment:
  organization-defined events] occur;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>g. Protecting authenticator content from unauthorized disclosure
  and modification;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>h. Requiring individuals to take, and having devices implement,
  specific controls to protect authenticators; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>i. Changing authenticators for group or role accounts when
  membership to those accounts changes.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

  </td>
  <td width="17%" valign=top style='width:17.32%;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid black 1.0pt;border-right:solid black 1.0pt;

  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>AUTHENTICATOR MANAGEMENT | PASSWORD-BASED AUTHENTICATION<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:
  6.0pt;margin-left:0in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;mso-bidi-font-family:
  Vrinda'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width="33%" valign=top style='width:33.12%;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid black 1.0pt;border-right:solid black 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid black .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid black .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid black .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>For password-based authentication:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>(a) Maintain a list of commonly-used, expected, or compromised
  passwords and update the list [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]
  and when organizational passwords are suspected to have been compromised
  directly or indirectly;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>(b) Verify, when users create or update passwords, that the
  passwords are not found on the list of commonly-used, expected, or
  compromised passwords in IA-5(1)(a);<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>(c) Transmit passwords only over cryptographically-protected
  channels;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>(d) Store passwords using an approved salted key derivation
  function, preferably using a keyed hash;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>(e) Require immediate selection of a new password upon account
  recovery;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>(f) Allow user selection of long passwords and passphrases,
  including spaces and all printable characters;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>(g) Employ automated tools to assist the user in selecting
  strong password authenticators; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>(h) Enforce the following composition and complexity rules:
  [Assignment: organization defined composition and complexity rules].<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>

  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>a. Develop an incident response plan that:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>1. Provides the organization with a roadmap for implementing its
  incident response capability;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>2. Describes the structure and organization of the incident
  response capability;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>3. Provides a high-level approach for how the incident response
  capability fits into the overall organization;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>4. Meets the unique requirements of the organization, which
  relate to mission, size, structure, and functions;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>5. Defines reportable incidents;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>6. Provides metrics for measuring the incident response
  capability within the organization;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>7. Defines the resources and management support needed to
  effectively maintain and mature an incident response capability;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>8. Addresses the sharing of incident information;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>9. Is reviewed and approved by [Assignment: organization-defined
  personnel or roles] [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>10. Explicitly designates responsibility for incident response
  to [Assignment: organization defined entities, personnel, or roles].<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;

  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;

  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;

  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>a.
  Develop, approve, and maintain a list of individuals with authorized access
  to the facility where the system resides;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>b.
  Issue authorization credentials for facility access;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>c.
  Review the access list detailing authorized facility access by individuals
  [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>d.

  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>a.
  Enforce physical access authorizations at [Assignment: organization-defined
  entry and exit <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>points
  to the facility where the system resides] by:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>1.
  Verifying individual access authorizations before granting access to the
  facility; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>2.
  Controlling ingress and egress to the facility using [Selection (one or
  more): [Assignment: organization-defined physical access control systems or
  devices]; guards];<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>b.
  Maintain physical access audit logs for [Assignment: organization-defined
  entry or exit points];<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>c.
  Control access to areas within the facility designated as publicly accessible
  by implementing the following controls: [Assignment: organization-defined
  physical access controls];<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>d.
  Escort visitors and control visitor activity [Assignment:
  organization-defined circumstances requiring visitor escorts and control of
  visitor activity];<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>e.
  Secure keys, combinations, and other physical access devices;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>f.
  Inventory [Assignment: organization-defined physical access devices] every
  [Assignment: <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>organization-defined
  frequency]; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>g.
  Change combinations and keys [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]
  and/or when keys are lost, combinations are compromised, or when individuals
  possessing the keys or combinations are transferred or terminated.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

  color:black'>a. Develop, document, and disseminate to [Assignment:

  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>1. [Selection (one or more): Organization-level;
  Mission/business process-level; System level] planning policy that:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;

  management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance;
  and<o:p></o:p></span></p>

  directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>2. Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the planning
  policy and the associated planning controls;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>b. Designate an [Assignment: organization-defined official] to
  manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the planning
  policy and procedures; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>c. Review and update the current planning:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;

  </td>
  <td width="33%" valign=top style='width:33.12%;border-top:none;border-left:

  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>a. Develop security and privacy plans for the system that:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>1. Are consistent with the organization’s enterprise
  architecture;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>2. Explicitly define the constituent system components;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>3. Describe the operational context of the system in terms of
  mission and business processes;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>4. Identify the individuals that fulfill system roles and
  responsibilities;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>5. Identify the information types processed, stored, and
  transmitted by the system;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>6. Provide the security categorization of the system, including
  supporting rationale;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>7. Describe any specific threats to the system that are of
  concern to the organization; <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>8. Provide the results of a privacy risk assessment for systems
  processing personally identifiable information;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>9. Describe the operational environment for the system and any
  dependencies on or connections to other systems or system components;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>10. Provide an overview of the security and privacy requirements
  for the system;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>11. Identify any relevant control baselines or overlays, if
  applicable;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
  none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;

  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>INFORMATION SECURITY PROGRAM PLAN<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width="33%" valign=top style='width:33.12%;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid black 1.0pt;border-right:solid black 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid black .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid black .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid black .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>a. Develop and disseminate an organization-wide information
  security program plan that:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>1. Provides an overview of the requirements for the security
  program and a description of the security program management controls and
  common controls in place or planned for meeting those requirements;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>2. Includes the identification and assignment of roles,
  responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational
  entities, and compliance;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>3. Reflects the coordination among organizational entities
  responsible for information security; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>4. Is approved by a senior official with responsibility and
  accountability for the risk being incurred to organizational operations
  (including mission, functions, image, and reputation), organizational assets,
  individuals, other organizations, and the Nation;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>b. Review and update the organization-wide information security
  program plan [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following
  [Assignment: organization-defined events]; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>c. Protect the information security program plan from
  unauthorized disclosure and modification.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>

  <td width="8%" valign=top style='width:8.64%;border:solid black 1.0pt;

  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span

  </td>

  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>INFORMATION SECURITY AND PRIVACY RESOURCES<o:p></o:p></span></p>

  <td width="33%" valign=top style='width:33.12%;border-top:none;border-left:

  mso-border-alt:solid black .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>a. Include the resources needed to implement the information
  security and privacy programs in capital planning and investment requests and
  document all exceptions to this requirement;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>b. Prepare documentation required for addressing information
  security and privacy programs in capital planning and investment requests in
  accordance with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, policies,
  regulations, standards; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>c. Make available for expenditure, the planned information
  security and privacy resources.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>

  mso-border-top-alt:solid black .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid black .5pt;

  mso-border-alt:solid black .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>PLAN OF ACTION AND MILESTONES PROCESS<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width="33%" valign=top style='width:33.12%;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid black 1.0pt;border-right:solid black 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid black .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid black .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid black .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>a.
  Implement a process to ensure that plans of action and milestones for the
  information security, privacy, and supply chain risk management programs and
  associated organizational systems:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>1.
  Are developed and maintained;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>2.
  Document the remedial information security, privacy, and supply chain risk

  </td>
  <td width="33%" valign=top style='width:33.12%;border-top:none;border-left:

  mso-border-alt:solid black .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>a. Conduct a risk assessment, including:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>1. Identifying threats to and vulnerabilities in the system;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>2. Determining the likelihood and magnitude of harm from
  unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruption, modification, or
  destruction of the system, the information it processes, stores, or
  transmits, and any related information; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>3. Determining the likelihood and impact of adverse effects on
  individuals arising from the processing of personally identifiable
  information;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>b. Integrate risk assessment results and risk management
  decisions from the organization and mission or business process perspectives
  with system-level risk assessments;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>c. Document risk assessment results in [Selection: security and
  privacy plans; risk assessment report; [Assignment: organization-defined
  document]];<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>d. Review risk assessment results [Assignment:
  organization-defined frequency];<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>e. Disseminate risk assessment results to [Assignment:
  organization-defined personnel or roles]; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
  text-autospace:none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;
  color:black'>f. Update the risk assessment [Assignment: organization-defined
  frequency] or when there are significant changes to the system, its
  environment of operation, or other conditions that may impact the security or
  privacy state of the system.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>

  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span

  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:

  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;mso-bidi-font-family:
  Vrinda'>VULNERABILITY SCANNING<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width="33%" valign=top style='width:33.12%;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid black 1.0pt;border-right:solid black 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid black .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid black .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid black .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.95pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;color:black'>a.
  Monitor and scan for vulnerabilities in the system and hosted applications
  [Assignment: organization-defined frequency and/or randomly in accordance
  with organization-defined process] and when new vulnerabilities potentially
  affecting the system are identified and reported;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.95pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;color:black'>b. Employ
  vulnerability monitoring tools and techniques that facilitate
  interoperability among tools and automate parts of the vulnerability
  management process by using standards for:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.95pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;color:black'>1.
  Enumerating platforms, software flaws, and improper configurations;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.95pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;color:black'>2.
  Formatting checklists and test procedures; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.95pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;color:black'>3.
  Measuring vulnerability impact; <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.95pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;color:black'>c.
  Analyze vulnerability scan reports and results from vulnerability monitoring;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.95pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;color:black'>d.
  Remediate legitimate vulnerabilities [Assignment: organization-defined
  response times] in accordance with an organizational assessment of risk;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.95pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;color:black'>e. Share
  information obtained from the vulnerability monitoring process and control
  assessments with [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] to
  help eliminate similar vulnerabilities in other systems; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:6.0pt;
  margin-left:.95pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif;color:black'>f. Employ
  vulnerability monitoring tools that include the capability to readily update
  the vulnerabilities to be scanned.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>

  detect and eradicate malicious code;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>b.
  Automatically update malicious code protection mechanisms as new releases are
  available in <o:p></o:p></span></p>

  with organizational configuration management policy and procedures;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>c.
  Configure malicious code protection mechanisms to:<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>1.
  Perform periodic scans of the system [Assignment: organization-defined

  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif'>2.
